paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: Individuals from endemic areas in Portugal, Brazil, and Japan
patients.phenotype: Familial amyloid polyneuropathy (FAP) with high penetrance

individual_records.evidence_sentence: In endemic areas of Portugal, the penetrance is high, with approximately 80% developing disease by age 50 years.

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met variant is known to cause FAP and has high penetrance in endemic regions.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families in endemic areas.
variants.population_frequency: Prevalence of 4% in northern Sweden, 1:538 in northern Portugal.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on population studies.
variants.source_location: Specific section on Val30Met in the Genetics section.
variants.additional_notes: High penetrance in endemic areas, variable penetrance in non-endemic areas.
key_quotes: In endemic areas of Portugal, the penetrance is high, with approximately 80% developing disease by age 50 years.
Despite the high frequency of the Val30Met mutation in the endemic areas of Sweden (4%), there is relatively low penetrance: 11% by age 50.

patients.phenotype: Cardiac amyloidosis, typically presenting after age 60

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The Val122Ile mutation has been found in 10% of African Americans over the age of 65 years who have severe HF.

functional_data.summary: The Val122Ile variant leads to misfolding of TTR monomers and is associated with a cardiac phenotype.

variants.population_frequency: Prevalence of approximately 3.4% among African Americans.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on population studies.
variants.source_location: Specific section on Val122Ile in the Genetics section.
variants.additional_notes: Age-dependent penetrance is not well defined.
key_quotes: It presents with a cardiac phenotype, usually earlier than ATTRwt, typically during or after the sixth decade of life.

patients.demographics: Common in British and Irish populations
patients.phenotype: Mixed phenotype of HF and polyneuropathy

individual_records.phenotype_details: Mixed phenotype with severe autonomic neuropathy
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Thr60Ala is the most common variant in the British and Irish populations, presenting with a mixed phenotype of HF and polyneuropathy.

functional_data.summary: The Thr60Ala variant is associated with a mixed phenotype of heart failure and polyneuropathy.

variants.population_frequency: Common in British and Irish populations.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on population studies.
variants.source_location: Specific section on Thr60Ala in the Genetics section.
variants.additional_notes: Neurologic manifestations are more prevalent at an earlier stage.
key_quotes: Neurologic manifestations are more prevalent at an earlier stage, while cardiac involvement is usually present on diagnosis.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant TTR variants and penetrance data were extracted successfully.
